unnormalised: Mumbai, India – 27/10/2023 – Indian manufacturers are increasingly adopting sophisticated inventory forecasting techniques to optimize supply chains and reduce costs, especially ahead of the Diwali season rush. A recent report by the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) indicates a 15% increase in the adoption of AI-powered forecasting solutions within the sector since January 2023.

unnormalised: "Companies like Tata Steel and Mahindra & Mahindra are leveraging predictive analytics to anticipate demand fluctuations and minimize stockouts," says Dr. Priya Sharma, a logistics expert at IIM Bangalore. The shift comes as businesses grapple with volatile raw material prices and disruptions stemming from global geopolitical events.

unnormalised: Many SMEs are turning to cloud-based solutions, offering affordable access to advanced forecasting capabilities. A webinar scheduled for 14/11/2023 at 11:00 hrs IST aims to educate smaller businesses on the benefits of inventory optimization. Initial projections for Q4 2023 show a potential reduction in inventory holding costs of up to 8% for companies utilizing these advanced systems, a significant boost for profitability before the financial year closes on 31/03/2024. The goal is to ensure timely delivery to consumers during festivals.
